title: Alex Günsberg
text:
I am a PhD Candidate in Finance at GSF—The Graduate School of Finance, affiliated with Hanken School of Economics. My research focuses on Household Finance, Behavioral Finance, and Urban Economics, with clear influences from my machine learning background.
Over the past decade, I co-founded and worked with startups, which helped me develop a mindset of getting things done, resilience, and a good understanding of people and what drives them. Additionally, my roles as a Senior Sales Manager at a CTA hedge fund and as a Data Scientist at a Nasdaq-listed semiconductor company provided me with experience in financial strategy, market analysis, and programming skills in Python, as well as basic skills in R and SQL.

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Teaching
Thesis supervisor for 30 M.Sc. and B.Sc. students (2021-2024)

Chairman for 42 B.Sc. Seminars
Grading +100 referee reports and seminar presentations

Mentee in Hanken’s Teacher Mentor Program, Pilot group (2022)

title: Alex Günsberg

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Personal life
Characterized by a relentless drive, hard work ethic, and a penchant for innovation, I bring a unique blend of experience and skills to my academic pursuits. Before pursuing my PhD, I honed my analytical abilities as a Data Scientist, became proficient in Python, and gained entrepreneurial experience.
Outside academia, I’m family-centric and maintain a balanced lifestyle, enjoying activities like CrossFit and endurance sports. I am preparing for my first Ultra-cycling race this summer and have competed in a few ultra-trail running races.
